main event: Four white amber lights were observed on a radar scope, stationary and not moving in any direction, over Orcas Island, Washington on August 23, 1952.
interesting points: The lights were observed through a ground-radar scope and were not four bodies of aircraft.
The possibility is that there was a radar malfunction or unusual radar condition which caused this presentation.
On August 2, 1962, two adults and three children observed a bright light in the sky over the Orcas Island area that was approximately 100 yards in diameter and appeared to be rotating.
The object was visible for several minutes and then disappeared, making no sound and being several hundred feet above the ground.
The witness reported seeing a triangle of some luminous bright objects moving very fast, with some objects falling out of formation.
sighted object: four white amber lights on a radar scope; a bright rotating light in the sky
witnesses: radar operators; two adults and three children
photographs: no photographs present in the report
